Summary Heading: Property meets expectations; staff exceeds it
Summary: The facilities at this Residence Inn are standard and as expected. Comfortable and well-equipped. A bit dated, but other than being able to hear heavy footsteps from the room above me nothing that was a problem.  The front desk and breakfast staff make up for it by being terrific. They helped with local recommendations, ensured that I had what I needed, and even (suprisingly) helped with a quick clothing repair.  It's a short walk to a very good coffee shop and 3-4 restaurants, and a short drive to many others.  I will stay here again when I return to the area.

Finding the hotel is a bit difficult due to the trees around the sign.    The check in was quick and professional.  We were given our room and told where the fitness center room was and what time breakfast was served.    Our room was spacious and clean.  The mattress was a bit too soft, but acceptable.  The water closet portion of the bathroom took some "gymnastics" to get in and out of it since it was just a bit too small.  Our room was on the outer perimeter of the property next to a school bus lot.  The school buses begin moving around at 5:30 a.m., which might be too early for some people, but not me. Room tip: Ask to be away from the school bus lot if you are staying there on a school night.

Was told to park in a drop spot at from hotel, meanwhile my room was in very back of all the buildings. I usually love residence inn, this place my room is out dated. Carpet was very worn out. No one came for 9 days to clean my room or empty garbage. I work nights and asked them to come after 2 they couldnt accommodate.  Front desk staff are very nice . No coffee or water in lobby during day. For 9 days the breakfast never changed . No waffles, no pancakes. Scrabbled eggs and sausage every day. They have no to go containers, which makes bringing  food back to room very difficult. Not impressed at all for a Marriott hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just wanted to leave some comments about the above and beyond customer service I experienced at the Costa Mesa Residence Inn. I work for a tech company based in Northern California, and we had an incident where a colleague left behind a laptop. Not only did they help track it down, but when we ordered the wrong shipping method Kelvin helped find and attach the new shipping label. Additionally, he had the hotel schedule a FedEx pickup to ensure the package got back in time. I spent several years at a premium hotel brand in Silicon Valley and this is the kind of Customer Service that makes guests feel welcome and builds loyalty. Keep it up!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A nice, quiet place to stay

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay at this CM/NB property

I have to say that staff at this property were friendly and service oriented. My room was clean and comfortable.  My sleep was quiet and restful.  The gym had a good choice of cardio machines that operated well.  Both the breakfast buffet and evening snacks were very good and the workers that serviced it were very good. Great that they offered steamed rice in the morning.  The only other RI property that I have found steamed rice for breakfast was at one of there Sunnyvale properties.  For an older Residence Inn property I thought it was a very good and well maintained property and I would not hesitate to stay at
Manager Response: Dear SeminarTrekker,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn Costa Mesa Newport Beach for your recent business visit to the city. Summary Heading: This hotel made a long term stay much easier

No, it is not a luxury hotel (or pretending to be one) but it DOES provide clean and comfortable accommodations, good breakfast, frequent dinner socials and amenities that create a homey feel for the guests. The staff is extremely friendly and they generate a family atmosphere.  Thank you.

My room was close to the facility next door with the school buses, so the sound of buses woke me up in the morning. The room was clean (the kitchen was spotless!) except for stains on the shower curtain. Customer service and breakfast were ok, but both could use some improvement. Parking was free and plentiful.
Manager Response: Dear CosmicExplorer,  Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your stay with us. Summary: Absolutely wonderful stay. If you're looking for an extended stay hotel anywhere in or near Costa Mesa, look no further! Everyone here was really sweet and helpful. I spent close to 3 months here and did not feel like I was at a hotel.. it felt more like a neighborhood/community :) The breakfast is delicious and has many options available. The evening mixes too are fun! They have a lovely pool, hot tub and gym as well. Big shout out to Sue for having a great team. I loved the time spent and the conversations with Gina, Grant, David, Kimberly, Antony, Joy, Kayla and Caramella!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is conveniently placed near the freeway, Shopping malls and restaurants are few minutes drive away. The rooms and service were satisfactory.  The breakfast area is in renovation, so it wasn't a pleasant experience. The swimming pool and gym are good enough. It was a pleasure speaking with front desk people. Whenever i requested something, it was answered and taken care.   The AC unit noise can be bothering sometimes and the footsteps of people on 2nd floor may be disturbing if you stay in 1st floor.

This property is undergoing a refresh - it does have some contemporary touches, but ultimately the property is pretty old. The lobby was perfectly preserved from the 80/90s. Service was good.  We went while they were renovating their breakfast area - so it did feel a little ghetto with the disposable foam plates and cramped eating area. The offerings didn't look that appealing, but I might be jaded by the atmosphere.  They had a leak, so they upgraded the two rooms we reserved and put both rooms into the upstairs penthouse. Summary Heading: Love the two-story loft a Layout
Summary: If you choose the two-story loft layout, you will be very happy. You walk into a nice living room and kitchen area with a big bedroom off the living room and a private bath. Walking upstairs though, puts you in a loft with a big open ceiling layout where you can look from the loft down to the living room. The loft is a second bedroom, and also has its own private bathroom. Love this cool design the residence Inn has. I’ve seen it at another one of their hotels.

The front desk assured me the place was very safe and they had 24 hour security that walked the premises. I’m not sure about that as I never saw any security but regardless I did feel very safe. After checking into my room I could appreciate the layout of the property. I felt like I was staying in my own apartment. It was nice to take walks in the evening and in the morning to breakfast. The breakfast food quality and variety was excellent and the service was amazing. I wanted to move in! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will stay again if I’m in the area.

Summary: Stayed here because our place was getting renovated. It surpassed my expectations.  The studio had everything a family of 4 could need. The pool was always clean and perfect and they had mixers on Monday thru Wednesday.  Great stay.

Summary Heading: Great property and staff, near beaches and shopping
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights to spend time around the Newport Beach area. This is a great hotel for a family as there is a pool and basketball court available. The staff was fantastic, very helpful and even interacted with my kids. The rooms were well maintained and it was very quiet at night. The location is very good as the beaches aren't very far and there are plenty of restaurants and shopping options close by. It's right off the highway as well and easy to get around.  I will certainly stay here again for any trips in the area. One of the best stays I've had at a Residence Inn.
Manager Response: This means so much to us to hear how much you enjoyed your stay - and one of the best Residence Inn's.  We want to make our guests feel like part of our family and so glad to hear you really got to experience all that Costa Mesa and Newport Beach have to offer.  We will look forward to seeing you when you return to the area!

Summary Heading: I felt like I was at home!
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights for business.  2 of the nights they had snacks in the lobby (chicken on a stick, salad, chips, etc) and beer and wine!  Perfect, didn't need to go out to dinner.  The staff was exceptionally friendly, the free breakfast was great.  I LOVED the units, I drove back each day feeling like I was going to my own condo.  The layout felt like a little resort, a cute pool and hot tub too.  There is a mini outside mall next door for pizza, asian, liquor store - very convenient!
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you liked the layout of our property and how you felt right at home.  The breakfast is a great way to start off a busy work day and you were able to come and experience our RI Mix at night.  Our location is so close to some neat restaurants right next door or right down the street.  We hope that when business or vacation brings you back to Orange County that you will come "home" again.

As well as location for 2 activities ( skateboarding and indoor jumping) This was our first time to this area.    The customer service is amazing.  The ladies working the front desk are sweet and very accommodating.    Free hot and cold breakfast which is better then some other chain hotels.  Enjoyed the breakfast a lot      To our surprise they also do free dinners on certain nights.  It was 2 of our nights.  We took advantage of one of the 2 nights.  Pulled bbq chicken (options for sandwiches) baked beans. free wine and beer as well as non alcoholic.    This place also has a coin laundry room which helped with not having to pack a lot.    We didn’t

The Penthouse suite is great for families and so glad you were able to enjoy breakfast as well as the RI Mix we offer Monday-Wednesday nights.  The pool and sports court is great for the kids but glad you had time for a workout in our fitness room.  We are so happy that you found us and we look forward to seeing you again when you come back to visit Orange County.

Summary: We stayed here for 2 weeks. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. The staff were wonderful. They were very welcoming and extremely helpful. They definitely make the hotel feel very inviting. There was a great choice for breakfast and always plenty of food available. The 3 nights that snacks were offered was an added bonus too.Great location for Disney at Anaheim. Not far from LA and San Diego zoo also.
Manager Response: Costa Mesa is a great location to allow you to enjoy all the fine dining and shopping we have but also close to all the beaches as well as Disneyland, LA and San Diego.  Our suites give you more room to relax - especially when you are here for 2 weeks.  So glad you were able to start your day off with breakfast and then enjoyed the RI Mix 3 nights a week.  We hope that you will come "home" again next time you are coming to the area.

There's a small pool and hot tub, nice fire pit area and even a sport court with basketball, tennis and badminton. However, its the staff here that has been so accommodating and friendly that makes it a 5 star in my book!. They provide a shuttle and are so helpful in getting you wherever you need to be. We have enjoyed the free breakfast every morning. There's a good variety of food to choose from eggs, breakfast meats(which change daily), oatmeal,fresh waffles, a nice selection of baked goods,different yogurts and fresh fruit. The servers are always willing to get you whatever you need. Three nights a
Manager Response: I am so happy you are enjoying your stay with us and getting to know the property.  Sounds like you and the family have been enjoying our sport court and getting to relax by the pool and firepit at night.  It's great that you are not missing our fantastic breakfast in the morning and the RI Mix at night is nice to just unwind and spend time with family.  We look forward to seeing you over the next few weeks during your stay.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Room with Lots of Amenities
Summary: There is a lot packed in a small space in this room, with full kitchens, a sofa and TV, WiFi, a separate commode and shower/bath combo room, large vanity, a King bed, two spacious wardrobe closets, good bedside lighting.  We appreciated kitchen utensils and a refrigerator.   Husband appreciated the comfortable sofa for reading and watching TV.  I was happy we had a sliding glass door to outdoors so we could get fresh air, but after realizing there was no screen door, didn’t feel comfortable having it open.  It took us a night to get used to the ventilation system and turn the thermostat down and add a blanket, which is why I wouldn’t give this Inn a five star — something about the ventilation was lacking. Disappointing dining room — very small for the number of folks looking for

Summary Heading: Spacious/updated but a few minor issues
Summary: Great place to stay overall. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite with the loft. It was very spacious with a nice full kitchen, large living room, and two full baths. The stairs to the loft were fairly steep, so you have to keep a close eye on the little ones. They had updated smart TVs that could log in to your Netflix account which was great for watching your favorite movies/TV shows. Breakfast was just okay - all the usuals you see at a Residence Inn.   Location was good for our purposes, but the street could be fairly busy so you have to wait a bit to pull out of the lot. I took off one star for having to pay for parking. This is usually free at most Residence Inns. We would stay here again the next time our family is in the area.
Manager Response: none

I really appreciated the time she took in helping me which made my stay even better. In addition, I would like to thank the front desk associate Tiffany for being very kind and informative. She directed me to a local pizza restaurant literally right down the street and I must say great recommendation Tiffany! Overall I had a great stay, room was clean, complimentary breakfast was delicious, staff was very inviting and the hotel grounds were well kept.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very spacious room and 5 minutes from the airport. They have a a nice Breakfast and a reception in the evening with food and wine . Front desk staff the best. They have restaurants next door and within 5 minutes to the South Coast Plaza a huge mall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location: A+ (safe, clean, block from freeway, restaurants close, including In & Out, Newport Beach pier)  Rooms: A+ (BIG with frigs)   Breakfast: A+  (Hot and cold items.  Healthy and not healthy items)     Staff:  A+ (Kind and helpful)
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and got to experience Costa Mesa and all the great things we have to offer.  Our suites are spacious and having a full kitchen helps to have snacks and goodies when you need them.  Start your day with a good breakfast so you can explore the beaches and shopping in our area .  Look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: The location was amazing.  Restaurants within walking distance.  Very safe area.  5 minutes from the Newport Beach pier.  Rooms were spacious.  Breakfast was wonderful and the staff was very kind and helpful!
Manager Response: Sounds like you really took advantage of your time to explore all the great things here in Costa Mesa.  Happy to hear that you felt welcome and right at home.  Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: I could not have had a better stay
Summary: From the moment I checked in (way early in the day, but I was cheerfully accommodated) I was greeted with smiling faces and great service.  My room was amazingly spacious, immaculately clean, and perfectly equipped.  The TVs in the room looked brand new, and the channel selection was excellent.  The complimentary breakfast was outstanding.  Lots of juices, eggs in two styles, sausage, and all of it was fresh and hot.  The staff was very cordial and helpful.  By day two they knew me by name and greeted me warmly.    The fitness center was great.  The treadmills, bikes, and weights were all in great shape.  Plenty of clean towels were available too.  The treadmills had very good built-in TVs.  The location felt completely safe and was nice.  There were plenty of eateries nearby
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay at the Residence Inn.  Will be sure to pass your great comments on to our team and let them know how much you enjoyed our many amenities and spacious suites.  Your "home away from home" will be ready when you return.

Summary: Checked into hotel yesterday. What seemed to be fairly cool with new streaming tv turned out to be a 3-week unresolved old problem. Here for two nights already with NO TV. We call and are told "we are working on it". When I confronted and said "we hear this is an ongoing unresolved issue for the past three weeks they do not deny it.   Why no notice at check-in time?  Why no letter of apologies from management?  Why no offer of compensation?  What exactly are we paying for?    Oh, and no Internet for most of the day. I can spend this money some place else and be treated way better. And my status with Marriott is Platinum, so imagine what other guest with lesser or no status are getting.   Not meeting expectations in any way. And, I made the comment that the General Manager must
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  I apologize for the inconveniences that occurred while we were upgrading our new entertainment system.  I can't apologize enough and would like to contact you regarding your stay.  Can you please email me at sue.cooke@Marriott.com so I can get some additional information about your stay.

Summary: I booked this hotel for its proximity to John Wayne Airport and the beach. I called the hotel to request a pick up in their FREE AIRPORT SHUTTLE, and only waited about 10mins. The driver, Tony, was very friendly. Gave lots of recommendations for local eats and things to do. Although i was early, the check in process was quick and smooth. This property is a generation 1 Resi Inn, so you must leave the office to access you room/s, which is easy with the provided property map. My room, a King studio suite, was nicely laid out and pleasantly quiet.The hotel is about 10mins from Newport Beach Pier, maybe $9 Lyft ride... The hotel does provide free breakfast and a managers reception Mon-Wed night with free beer, wine, soft drinks and light appetizers. Will definitely stay again.  My
Manager Response: none

Summary: We choose the residence inn for its location.  It was close to fine shopping and the beach.  However, we realized this place is more convenient for long stays and or families with young children since it had a kitchenette in every room.  We stayed for a weekend and the first night upon arrival when we wanted to take a shower realized the water was running from both tap and shower head.  This was corrected the second day.  The front desk staff were very helpful and provided directions to restaurants and shopping malls.  The breakfast was okay.  Marriott has put this residence in category 5.  I believe this place in comparison with other Marriott hotels we stayed, does not deserve more than a catagory 3.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Residence Inn Costa Mesa Newport Beach is the old style Residence Inn, but what make it very good is the staff.Sue Cook GM And her staff are excellent and very focused on guest satisfaction. Grounds are kept very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Easy drive to Disneyland or Newport Beach
Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn for 3 nights.  Our primary purpose for being there was to enjoy Disneyland with our grandkids who were staying on the Disneyland property. It's a typical RI one bedroom suite with microwave, refrigerator, cable TV, and free wifi. Parking was $10/night. We had a bottom floor residence and were able to hear people walking above us early in the a.m. Maid service was good and the complimentary breakfast was ok with the usual cereal, scrambled eggs, yogurt, waffles, coffee and juice available.  The pool was nice with lots of patio space with tables and chairs to spread out.  One issue was the amount of extra costs added on to the basic price of the unit....$34/night including the parking and a city tax.  It just seemed excessive but you would pay more
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a very spacious, clean room that included a full kitchen:  refrigerator, stove, microwave, coffee maker, even dishwasher!  A living room area, and lovely bathroom.  There is a pool with jacuzzi to hang out at.  Wonderful breakfast included.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn Costa Mesa on July 9, 2017, as we were attending a wedding in Newport Beach.  We used a Marriott Reward's certificate and weren't expecting much.  However, upon arrival Sue Cooke, the General Manager greeted us with a warm welcome, and allowed us to check-in early.  As Elite members, we rolled the dice, and secured an additional 500 reward points, which were then added to our account.  It was a nice touch.  The room was very clean, and had modern stainless steel kitchen appliances.  We drove to Halal Guys for lunch, and brought the food back to the hotel.  It was quiet and comfortable and we were napped before the evening's festivities.    In the morning, the breakfast buffet was more than I expected.  They had bread, cereals, yogurt, oatmeal,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing the Costa Mesa Residence Inn while attending a wedding.  I am so happy I got to meet you at check in and so glad you enjoyed your suite.  We have so many great restaurants in the area for lunch and dinner, but happy you started your day out with our great breakfast.  We hope you will come visit again soon and get to try some other great places in Costa Mesa.

Summary: I stayed in this property for more than 1 month on a business visit arriving from a foreign country.  I booked this hotel, based on the proximity and their offer for complimentary shuttle service, which says 5mi radius during weekdays and 2mi during weekends.  Everyday I was made to feel like a beggar whenever I requested for shuttle. They were very rude to me and even shouted on me on a couple of occasions.  They refused the service on several times, leaving me stranded even though I was within the 5mi radius. Also, all the front desk people used to team up together and rebuke me. There was no point in escalating to the manager Sue as she is also on their side.  It was living hell for me for a month.  The property is good and rooms are fine, but the front desk staff are very
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about the hotel and the shuttle service.  As you know, our top priority is to get guests to and from work and the airport and we do offer shuttles within the 5 mile radius when available.  Certain areas we do not go to that have a large amount of traffic around it in the Irvine area like the District.  We also need to have the shuttle back at the hotel by 7pm and request guests to call for pickup to allow us to be back at the hotel by that time.  I apologize that you have called a few times to get picked up and were not and would appreciate you sending me an email to give me more details about the time we were unable accommodate you.

Summary: Residence Inn is a great alternative to a standard hotel.  Our family had room #121, 2nd floor King studio. Plenty of room that we didn't feel crowded.  Bathroom area was nice, lots of closet space, comfortable pillows, great décor and overall comfortable stay with all the space and full kitchen.  Only comment on room was the popcorn ceilings. There wasn't mold or any bad smells in our room, or bars on any sliding doors that we saw on the property as previous reviewers stated. .  Breakfast is appreciated especially when it's included. The pastries could be improved as well as the fruit options. We didn't run into seating problems and were there on a Fri and Sat night. Staff member Javier was great with the amount of people eating. Polite and attentive.   Our family likes to have
Manager Response: I am so glad you selected our hotel when coming to visit your daughter at UCI.  Sounds like you enjoyed all our many amenities like our fitness room, the sport court, pool, BBQ are and fire pit.  Our Breakfast is a great way to start the day and so glad that Javier was able to help you out.  I will pass on your comments also to Tony and let him know how much you appreciated his help.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Have stayed here about six times - always in a 2 bedroom suite - in fact this is the only reason we stay at this Residence Inn. I rated the property average as, for the first time, we had a suite facing the 73 freeway and whilst is was the Memorial Day weekend (less traffic) it was still a little on the noisy side. Two bedroom suites are not for the faint hearted  - they are on the second level with two flights of stairs to be climbed.  The living room and main bedroom are large and there is small kitchen/eating area that has everything you need for a short stay. The second bedroom is a loft (looks down on the living room) and is accessed by 15-20 stairs - more climbing. There is a community coin operated ($1.50 for each machine) laundry near reception.   A buffet breakfast is
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay during the Memorial Day weekend.  I am so glad you enjoyed the Penthouse Suite - they are great for families.  I am sorry about the noise - we do have double paned windows for our suites - but will look into more ways to help reduce the noise.  The breakfast is a great way to start the day and we do have additional seating at the pool.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I'm shocked to see the good ratings for this hotel. As a business traveler, I would never recommend this hotel. I walked into my room, smelled awful mold, took one look at the barred sliding glass doors (bottom floor) and walked right back out. The desk staff did handle the situation very well and cancelled my room without comment. I rebooked on my mobile phone at the Residence Inn John Wayne Airport which was much much better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I absolutely love going to any Residence Inn. They have rooms that are like apartments that myself and co-workers stay in. Great amenities such as hot tub & pool. Inexpensive laundry facilities, family & pet friendly. Although the staff is very friendly and accommodating, my least favorite staff was house keeping. "Bad taste in my mouth" as the saying goes. The staff has a shuttle and are willing to drive you to various locations within a certain mile radius for free. This particular hotel is located close to major freeways, shopping centers, restaurants. Among other wonderful amenities are the free breakfast and work out room. My favorite staff for Residence Inn is still that of the one in ST Louis MO..... but I love most all the staff at any Residence Inn. kind helpful folks.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay at our hotel.  Residence Inn is so great when you want extra space all the amenities we offer like the breakfast, Residence Inn Mix, and the outdoor area to relax after a long day.  I appreciate the comments about the staff and would really appreciate it if you could let me know about your housekeeping issues so we can make sure it gets corrected.  Our location is so great near the South Coast Plaza, beaches, and we have so many restaurants in the area.  We look forward to welcoming you home again soon!

Summary: The hotel, although very nice, decided to lock me out on an extended reservation on tax exemption Costa Mesa AAA travel & Marriott Rewards for Memorial Weekend after a block on my HSBC DEBIT CHARGE CARD was discussed at the desk due to English Bank holiday in Manchester. This occurred Thursday night 5/25/17 prior to check out June 2. The previous week on Friday night before the arena attack somebody left me a scary voicemail to my cellphone in conjuction with the terror event threatening to arrest me no bail on an IRS lawsuit basis. This was a computer generated voice. The African American clerk night shift allowed me back in for Thursday and Friday. And recharged the declined charge attempt. Thank you. Reminding you this is on the last week of the stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Residence Inn to stay at
Summary: I've stayed at a lot of Residence Inns and I have to say this one is probably the best. The staff is extremely nice, friendly and personable. The rooms look like they've recently been redone and everything was super comfortable. I would definitely recommend this place.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing to stay at our Residence Inn Costa Mesa Newport Beach.  I am so happy to hear that you liked the newly renovated rooms and that our staff made you feel right at home.  We hope that you will be back again soon to enjoy all the great things Costa Mesa has to offer!

Summary: The hotel is an older property it great condition. Rooms are very nicely done. Kitchen is wonderful. Very clean and comfortable. Staff is excellent. Breakfast staff was exceptional and so nice. was great every morning.
Manager Response: We are so happy that you came to stay at our Residence Inn Costa Mesa Newport Beach.  We are so happy you enjoyed our suites and started your day each day with our complimentary breakfast.  I will be sure to pass your great comments to our team and we look forward to seeing you again when you visit the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach area!

Summary Heading: Spend a little more money for a better experience
Summary: The hotel itself is old and outdated, although the room was okay. First day I checked in I noticed that the sheets were not clean, hair on sheets and towels. I was here for 4 days and never really saw an improvement. Also had dirty towels that i just threw on the floor. Had hoped to bring my wife and kids to stay here on a future business trip but will need to do more research, this just won't work for family or comfort.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us.  I am so sorry to hear that we did not address your issues during your stay and would appreciate it if you could send me an email to let me know more details about your stay and room.  Want to work with our team to ensure this was an isolated incident and your information will be helpful in training our team.  I look forward to hearing from you and making sue your next stay will meet the standard of service you have come to expect with Marriott.

Summary: This property is a fairly typical Residence Inn that's been updated.  They've done a nice job on the grounds as they are very well maintained.  The service at the front desk was very good and the breakfast was good as well.  It's conveniently located to get to many places in the area.  We had a good stay and would recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here a number of times and have always been very happy.  I have booked rooms for my family members, and they always enjoy their stay.   Celebrated a birthday gathering at the pool side (notified management ahead of time that i was going to have more than 50+ people, and they were more than accommodating).  This hotel is a perfect location & friendly service! - Easily accessible to/from John Wayne airport.   -Quick access to the 73, 55 or 405 freeways.   -Less than a mile from South Coast Plaza, a few blocks away from OC Fairgrounds (walking distance if you're up for it and want to avoid parking costs).  -Full kitchen with stove, oven, with utensils/dishes/kitchen ware -Complimentary breakfast (weekdays and weekends) hours vary -Complimentary coffee/tea all day in
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, well stocked kitchen. Great comfortable bed, sofa bed not so much. Breakfast is a normal average quality hotel food. Housekeeping was above average. Left out a few valuables I never should have, had no problems. Good people.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good choice in an expensive area
Summary: A friend gave us a free night at the hotel so I cannot comment on value. The hotel is conveniently but not centrally located nor is it near the beach. The pool is very nice, the rooms are large and clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom has a separate sink and toilet/shower-tub. The self-serve complimentary breakfast was okay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ignore the negative reviews - this place is more than decent
Summary: The exterior is nothing fancy and looks pretty old, but the interior has gone through a massive upgrade. I thought it was modern, clean, and very comfortable! What else I liked:  -Like all Residence Inns, they have a full breakfast buffet with REAL EGGS. I was totally prepared for powdered eggs given that this is a hotel, but NOPE - these are real, soft, buttery eggs, people!!!!!  -Front desk service was really nice  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This will be the fourth time we have stayed here. Location to our family is excellent (and why we kept coming back). This ended with this trip. Two of the three previous times we stayed, we noticed the "mildew-y" smell and said something to the front desk. There is really nothing they can do, but we wanted to point it out.   This time, it was very pronounced. Our option was to set the A/C down to a level that would take some humidity out of the air. This seemed to work, although on the first night, there was a horrendous odor of sewer / diaper in the room. This did not appear the second night.  Again, the room is dated and worn, the door does not sit in the frame well (quite the gap along the side) and the pillows on the bed needed to be replaced around 2012. This location is
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear how disappointed you were about your stay.  I would appreciate if you can reach out to me by email and give me details about your reservation so I can do additional research to understand most of your comments.  We just completed a room renovation and upset to hear that you think the rooms were dated and worn.  I will look forward to getting your email and addressing your concerns.

Summary: We stayed here before meeting the ferry for Catalina island. Our room had everything we needed. Linens were crisp and clean. The room was very nicely laid out and very clean. They allowed us to park our car there while we were at Catalina island with no extra charge. When we arrived back to the hotel to pickup our car Stuart who was working the front desk was so friendly and welcoming. Before retrieving our bags which they stored for us (no charge) as we were only allowed one bag on the ferry. He asked if we would be interested in the dinner and drinks they were offering (free of charge) before leaving for the airport. I believe he could see we were tired and hungry. Stuart is the kind of employee that every hotel should have on their front desk as he certainly made us feel so
Manager Response: I enjoyed reading your comments about the Residence Inn and especially about Stuart.  He is a great asset to our team and so happy that you got to meet him.  I am so glad we were able to store your bags while you enjoyed a day at Catalina and your timing was perfect to be back to enjoy our RI Mix.  We will look forward to seeing you for your next visit to Costa Mesa.

Summary: Having just spent a week at this hotel I can honestly state that it's comfortable enough and the excellent staff pushes my rating up a point for their hospitality.  I wouldn't call it tired but it's not new.  The grounds are well maintained and the rooms clean enough.  The overall Inn layout is the problem to me as you can hear people in adjoining rooms or if your on the first floor, the footsteps of those above you.    I'm probably being a little picky but I don't hear this in other Marriott hotels, Courtyards or Fairfield Inns?  Anthony at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful and Rosa was just as friendly and always kept the breakfast area well stocked and looking good!  Convenient to the beach areas as well as highways 55, 73 and 405 it was easy to get around OC
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at other Residence Inns and this one does not quite meet the quality threshold.   Bed linens were old and had cotton pill bugs like the sheets were dirty and old. They were promptly changed but not something one wants to deal with after a long day.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  We have passed on your comments to the housekeeping team to ensure this is an isolated issue. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and we hope we can host you again when your travels bring you back to Costa Mesa!  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: All rooms are suites so it had a full kitchen and a couch in front of a large flat screen. Comfortable king bed. Coffee and tea in room also they give a bag of popcorn to use in the microwave. Free hot breakfast off the lobby. Sausage, eggs, make your own waffles and toppings, hot rice, cereals including hot oatmeal. Nice pool and jacuzzi--water could have been a little hotter.Friendly staff. Will stay here again when in the area. No elevator so ask for ground floor if you have trouble with stairs. Near restaurants (Ciao Pizza within walking distance was great)  close to mall and high end restaurants. Not far from beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got a 2 BR unit which provided the space we needed. It was a little difficult lugging suitcases up the stairs to the unit. The parking lot was not close either. We noticed the light/fan unit didn't work and the icemaker was also on the blink. They came to replace the icemaker. We heard a dog in the unit below us occasionally, but it wasn't a problem. Breakfast was better than most places, with eggs, sausage, pastries, waffles, yogurt and fruit. This place even had steamed rice and rice seasoning for those who like that in the morning. The main building was a hike from our unit, but since the weather was good, the walk wasn't a problem. The location was good, close to Newport Beach, Costa Mesa, Crystal Cove State Park and Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing our hotel to be your "home away from home" while in town.  Our Penthouse suites are great for families and give the space with two bedrooms and two bathrooms.  I am happy to hear that our staff addressed your issues and will follow up with our team about the fan not being fixed.  Breakfast is the best way to start the day and we offer lots of choices including the Japanese breakfast items.  We are so happy you got to enjoy all the great things we offer here in Costa Mesa and hope you will come see us again soon.

Summary: First time staying at this Residence Inn, overall experience was very good!  We stayed in a two bedroom/two bathroom suite...very roomy!  The beds were comfortable and the room was mostly quiet even though the hotel is next to a freeway.  The breakfast served had a lot of variety...some thing for everyone. There are few things that weren't very good. 1)The second room is actually in a loft above the master bedroom.  So if you have someone sleeping in the second bedroom, the noise from the living room can be heard.  2)The appliances in the kitchen were pretty scratched up.  3) The swimming is small. 4) There is no atmosphere here.  But for a place to be near the beach and shopping...it's great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had an overall great stay at this hotel. Breakfast was good and staff was friendly. Much room available in the Penthouse Suite; enough for the girls weekend. Only cons were that housekeeping was not as tidy as we would of liked; lots of hair on the floor and garbage in the drawers. When we reported it to staff (Stuart), he was very accommodating and apologetic. He even rewarded us with points to our account. Will stay again...thanks Stuart!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a couple nights and had a nice visit.  The room seemed newly renovated but the pool/spa could use some cleaning up. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our requests.  They have a large breakfast area and had good choices each day.  The hotel is about 7 miles from Newport Beach which depending on day/time took us about 20 minutes to get there, very convenient.  We were able to walk to the shopping center next door for lunch & dinner.  We had some delicious pizza from Ciao! for lunch and amazing ramen for dinner from Kitakata Ramen Ban Nai.  The ramen place always had a crowd in front so we had to try it, which was an excellent decision.  We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you were able to enjoy some great dining right next door to the hotel.  Costa Mesa has so many great dining choices and hope you will try more next time you visit.  I will follow up with our team and ensure that the pool and spa are monitored throughout the day to make sure it is neat and orderly  Our location is so close to the beaches, Disneyland and a short drive to LA or San Diego.  We look forward to having you visit again soon

Summary: I havent stayed at a Residence inn in awhile.  Its nice, I like the room, it was large with a full kitchen.  The hotel is conveniently located off the freeway.  The breakfast was buffet style with white rice!
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you tried Residence Inn again and hope that you enjoyed the spacious suites and having a kitchen can be so convenient for keeping drinks and snacks handy.  Starting your day off with our breakfast is a great way to begin the day and we have added some additional items to the buffet including rice and miso soup.  I hope that you will choose Residence Inn again when you travel!

Summary: I stayed at this location with my 6 year old son, my sister and her two young children (ages 4 and 1), and our mother in June 2016. This hotel was truly perfect for our family. We stayed in the 2 bedroom penthouse and it was really nice. We all had plenty of room with the two bedrooms, a living room, two bathrooms, and a full kitchen. The first bedroom with the king is the nicest as it is an actual bedroom that closes off from the rest of the unit. The second bedroom is more of a loft with a half wall that overlooks the family room. And the couch in the family room turns into a bed as well. All the rooms on the property have been recently renovated.  The pool and hot tub were fun for the kids.  It wasn't busy and there were plenty of chairs and tables. The staff was very nice
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  The Penthouse Suite is so great for families and having a full kitchen available to keep stocked for the kids is very helpful when traveling.  We agree that our location is so convenient to South Coast Plaza, some amazing restaurants, and of course the beaches and Disneyland are just a short drive away.  LA and San Diego are just a day trip so keep that in mind on your next visit.  We are looking forward to seeing you again on your next visit to Orange County.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel with Many Positives and a Minor Annoyance
Summary: Checking in was a breeze.  The front desk agent was very friendly.  My first time at the hotel, and it was nice to see that they have a social hour in the early evening, where according to what I was informed by front desk agent, food and drinks, including alcohol were complimentary.  Room was typical residence inn, with large refrigerator, microwave, etc.    Only minor annoyance was that when I called from my room to request late check out, a guaranteed benefit for platinum (and gold) members, I was told by the representative to call back in the morning and see what was available.  I informed her that this is a benefit guaranteed for gold and plat elite.  She then responded that she still needed to see what the situation would be like the next day.  I answered that by saying,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Messed up our reservation/promised not kept
Summary: We reserved a penthouse suite thru their website 2-3 weeks in advance and when we get there they don't have our penthouse suite. If there is a problem on their end, they should have the courtesy to at least call me about their problem so I can go to another hotel. We are celebrating my daughters 21st birthday and the night shift lady promised me that she will arranged a surprise birthday presentation (cake, balloons) in our room when we comes back the following night but there is nothing! I was just totally disappointed with how they treated us.   They are just so unreliable even if you booked your accommodation through their website. If they promised you something don't get your hopes so high.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear about the issues you had during your stay.  I apologize that the room type you reserved was not available but I hope that our staff did offer you another room that would meet your needs.  And I would like to get some additional details so if you could email me so I can follow up and make sure this was an isolated incident.  I would really appreciate the additional information.

Summary Heading: Very Private Apartment + All the Advantages of a Full Service Hotel
Summary: Booked as a stop over between San Diego and Westlake Village, CA and it turned out to be an excellent choice. The reception staff were very friendly, courteous and the Happy Hour included not only wine but a very tasty buffet meal all inclusive Mon - Wed. Breakfast is also included 7 days a week. Our room had everything and was spotlessly clean so all in all a very good choice.
Manager Response: We are glad you decided to stop in Costa Mesa on your trip.  Sounds like you were able to enjoy both breakfast and our Residence Inn Mix at night which is a great start and finish to the day.  I hope that your travels bring you back to the area soon.

Summary: We have a great stay in Resident inn. Every thing very clean. Good breakfast and very suitable if you have or rent a car. Its also not far from down town and very center of Orange county.  Price per night also a strong point and the environment around was very good.
Manager Response: So happy you enjoyed your stay in Costa Mesa and there is so much to do within walking distance and a quick drive.  Hope you were able to visit South Coast Plaza and some of the beautiful beaches like Newport and Huntington Beach.  We hope that you will come again soon and see more that Orange County has to offer.

Summary: Checked in after arriving at SNA to rest up after a long day of travel. Promptly given the keys to our room, ground floor as requested since there are no elevators. We found this property to be quite different than every other RI property we've stayed. It's a complex of buildings with 4 or so units per building, two story. Interesting. Great grounds with nice pool and fire pit. Several restaurants are in easy walking distance. Plus, "The Camp" and "The Lab" are about 1/2 mile away.  While our room showed a little wear and tear it was clean and pretty well appointed. The bed was comfortable. Only downer was the shower and commode being in a very small space.  Traditional breakfast fare with one very notable exception. This is the first Marriott branded property offering free
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay at our Residence Inn.  We are one of the first generation of Residence Inn's and have separate buildings so you can park close and just walk right up to your room.  And the breakfast is a great way to start the day and we have been adding gluten free items to our buffet to make sure we accommodate all our guests needs.  And there is great dining in the area and the Camp and the Lab offer so many different options.  We hope you will come back soon and explore more of the great shopping and dining that Costa Mesa offers.

Summary: We arrived fairly late at night and it was very dark not much lighting In between the sections of rooms...I felt bad for the front desk lady being by herself...but she was so nice and kind....she gave us one of the newly remodeled rooms and even called to see how we liked it....it was nice and I thought her gesture was great...the free breakfast was great everything from make your own waffles to a selection of muffins and danishes.....there was a pool, basketball, and tennis court....the location isn't really close to any stores or restaurants....I would stay here as a pit stop and we did stay for just one day...
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay.  We have lighting throughout the property but will have our staff check all lights to make sure you feel safe and secure.  I am happy that you enjoyed our newly remodeled rooms and the breakfast is a great way to start the day.  We hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary: All of the rooms are exterior entrance, either 1st or 2nd floor and are suites.  The suite I was staying in was recently revamped with new appliances and furniture, and was very nice.  Wifi was good, strong signal even being in bldg 13 (far end of the parking lot).  Next door was a few nice restaurants (Italian pizza place was really good), liquor store, etc.  Highly recommend.  Offers free breakfast, and on Wed, Thurs, Fri they offer free dinner with beer/wine for a couple of hours.  Dinner wasn't anything to write home about, but it's free if you're on a tight budget.
Manager Response: We are excited to have completed our rooms renovation and so happy you like the new updated suites.  Glad you were able to enjoy breakfast and our Residence Inn Mix Monday through Wednesday is a nice way to unwind after a busy day.  We look forward to you coming back again soon and trying out some other restaurants in the area.

Summary Heading: Great suite for a fantastic price!
Summary: I traveled for work to Costa Mesa and spent Friday and Saturday night at this hotel.  The kitchen is fully stocked with stainless steel full size stove/oven, fridge, microwave and dishwasher.  There's a dining table, a quant sofa on which to watch TV and when you get tired, the TV swivels to face the bed.    There is a LOT of GREAT food in the area.  There's a great Ramen and another Japanese BBQ restaurant within walking distance.  Great rate for the amenities.  The service was also great!
Manager Response: We are so happy that enjoyed our hotel and all the great restaurants in Costa Mesa and we are so lucky to have some great ones right next door.  Having a full kitchen is so great if you want to cook or to store some leftovers when eating out.  We hope that you will come back again soon and try some other great food in the area and shopping at South Coast Plaza.

Summary: Front desk (Anthony) as well as ALL others really go out of their way to meet, greet and assist guests. We had a wonderful stay and after staying at multiple properties, will definitely try to return to this specific place.  We didn't have a chance to use pool and hot tub, but room, bed and breakfast were great! Thanks!
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay at the Costa Mesa Newport Beach Residence Inn.  I will pass on your great comments to Anthony and our team and thank them for helping make your stay enjoyable.  We look forward to you coming back and this time getting a chance to relax by the pool.

Summary: Overall we found it to be pleasant and the staff a great help. But we were completely ripped off by their driver - Rocky. Took advantage of people from out of town and even worse saw the staff at reception getting a kick back of cash for calling him. Brenda was wonderful always calling a taxi instead of trying to profit like other staff from their guests.
Manager Response: I appreciate your comments and am sorry to hear about the experience you had with one of the drivers we use.  If you could email me more details so I can follow up with him and understand exactly what happened.  I will also retrain the team to ensure we recommend drivers that are taking care of our guests.  I hope you will give us another try so we can show you the changes that we have made and look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: Nice quiet place away from hustle and bustle of beach or Disney but close enough to both.  Good breakfast. Excellent service. Carmella at the front desk is the jewel of their crown. Currently in process of upgrading rooms so it will only get better.  Did not use the pool.  It did not appear to be heated.  Has a sport court. It is a bit tough to find the first time but after that it is very convenient. They offer a free grocery shopping service and took excellent care of the room.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  Carmellia is a great asset to our hotel and she is very passionate about taking care of everyone.  We will be finished with our rooms renovation in just a few weeks and hope you will come check them out.  Our outdoor pool is heated to about 80 degrees so pretty comfortable, and our spa is great at night when you need to relax.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I had a stay here last week for leisure the room nice and the staff was friendly. Sue at the front desk was super sweet. There was a slight oversight on the housekeeping end in the room and Sue immediately acted and notified housekeeping and everything was great. A week later I had to come back down this way for work, I checked in and Maggie at the front desk was awesome and just as friendly as the rest. I was working an unusual schedule and they totally took care of that and were a little lenient with a late check out for me which was super helpful to me and they put me in a newly renovated room. Sue even went out of her way to email me after my first stay and this is when I realized she was the GM of the property I absolutely will come back to stay here again and I recommend
Manager Response: It was so great to meet you during your last stay and I was so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I am happy it worked out to let you stay a bit later since you been so busy the day before and you got to relax a bit before you headed home.  I will be sure to let Maggie know about your comments and we hope that we get to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed 1 night in a newly remodeled 2 Bedroom Penthouse Suite.  Check in process was quick and smooth and we were given a nice guide for area restaurants.  I don't think I would have been pleased with an older Suite since the property is quite old. Breakfast in the morning was traditional RI selection and quality.  Our key card didn't work and I had to walk back to the office several times, but outside of that it was a nice, convenient property and I would stay there again if I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Excited to hear that you were able to enjoy one of our newly renovated suites and hope you were able to try one of the many fantastic restaurants in the area.  I will pass on your comments about the door lock to our engineering to have them ensure it was an isolated incident.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Hotel room was clean with good facilities. Staff were ultra friendly, as expected in the USA, customer service is second to none.  The only let down was with regard to the breakfast utensils. Plastic plates, cutlery, styrene cups.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for making our hotel your "home away home" while visiting and so glad that our staff made you feel so welcome.  I understand that we will soon be offering more eco friendly utensils and plates for our breakfast and RI Mix.  We hope you will come see again when you travel to the area.

Summary: The staff was very accommodating and willing to help whether it was something at breakfast or vacuuming my room multiple times before my husband arrived with his allergies.  :) The property is well maintained even though they are currently renovating some of the rooms.  I was never disturbed by the construction.  My room had already been renovated and was nicely appointed with new appliances.  I enjoyed my stay here and would return.
Manager Response: We are so excited you stayed at the Costa Mesa Newport Beach Residence Inn and were able to enjoy one of our newly renovated rooms.  I will pass on your comments to our staff and how you appreciated their service to you.  We hope that you will come see us again soon.

Summary Heading: Very Solid Stay - Renovations in Process
Summary: The hotel is currently undergoing a renovation and we noticed a team working in a room very near ours.  Actually our room (a studio) was comfortable enough. It will be interesting to see what they change with the renovation.  We had a fire place but it is designed for logs and a log roll was not provided; I found out when I checked out that they are available for purchase at $5 each from the front desk - I wish that would have been mentioned at check in; we’d have enjoyed burning a log - it was very cold and windy when we stayed.    The tub did not have a grab bar so getting out was a little dicey for us old folks.  We were there on a reception evening and they had soft chicken tacos and tortilla chips.  They had salsa and cheese for toppings and that was it.  They had beer and
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your stay at the Residence Inn.  Our renovation is underway and the suites look so great and can't wait for you to come again and let us know how you like them.  I will be sure to pass on your feedback about the dinner and we can look at ways to improve and make it a bit more enjoyable.  And we will look at making sure guests know about the firelogs that you can purchase when you are placed in a room with a fireplace.  We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Where Everyone Knows Your Name * REMODELED * UPDATED * MODERN
Summary: I sleep in a hotel room about 225 nights a year. This property definitely tops my list for the "home away from home experience".  The shining star of this sweet place is the staff.  I always feel welcomed back.  Sue , the manager, is a hands on property Czar.  You see her all over the property, grilling the burgers and dogs on cook out night, out helping a guest into their car...she is everywhere.  The rest of the staff follows her lead and they always greet me with a huge smile, ask how I am doing...as well as helping me with all the details of my stay.  Andrea (who has a bigger smile than Andrea) and Anthony are my favorites, making me smile every dag day.  This property is being updated and WOW...beautiful and modern and nice.    I always reserve the penthouse as well, I love
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this wonderful review.  You are part of our family and we look forward to your visits.  I will be sharing this with our team and letting them know how much you appreciate them and we also can't wait for you to come stay and see the new suites.  BBQ night is so fun and we will make sure the firepit is on while you enjoy the hamburgers and hot dogs.  Breakfast is always the best start to the day and at night we do have so many restaurants in the area at the Mall, the Camp, and the Lab.  We can't wait to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Very nice, but rooms could have been cleaner
Summary: Great size room. We had insects in the room, and the bathtub could have been cleaner. Coffeemaker had not been cleaned in quite some time. Quiet, good noise isolation from the 405. Breakfast was excellent
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your visit.  I am sorry to hear that experienced some housekeeping issues and would love to get more details from you regarding your visit.  If you could email me so I can research your room and ensure that this was an isolated incident.  And I am glad you enjoyed our great breakfast to start your day off right.  We hope you will come back as we just began our rooms renovation and want to show off our new updated rooms.

Summary: We stayed at this property for almost two weeks over Christmas while our house was undergoing construction. The staff were all very nice and accommodating. We had a second floor room with penthouse. We enjoyed having extra space and using the fireplace. Upon arrival we noticed the dish towel had black hairs on it and the office chair had an odd white mark. We called the front desk and it was taken care of within minutes but made us a little uneasy at first. After that it was pretty smooth. It was quiet except that the door lock didn't work properly so you had to push the door handle down three or four times before you could leave which was noisy. The room had a very bad smell from the heater but it went away after we had the door open for a bit (until the heater came on again).
Manager Response: We are so happy you made our hotel your "home away from home" while your place was under construction.  I am sorry that you had issues when you arrived but happy to hear that our staff helped to ensure that everything was corrected.  I will have our engineering team look into your door lock issue and ensure it was an isolated incident.  We would be glad to bring you additional items for your room to help with any cooking you may be doing.  I hope that you will come and visit again if you are doing any other home renovations.

Summary: Spent one night on 12/28/15 Arrived in time for the nightly gathering and enjoyed the tacos and cold beer. We were exhausted after 8 flights and 4 cities in 3 days to see one of the kids for Christmas.  The property was nice and we were very comfortable. Stayed in room 523 and everything was fine. Left too early for breakfast so can comment. Good place for families, with a nice pool and basketball court area.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had quite a long travel day and so glad you were able to make it to the hotel in time to enjoy the Residence Inn Mix.  Sorry to hear you missed breakfast, but hope that will give you a reason to come back and see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Great place, Great Value & Great Perks!
Summary: What a great place to stay with family! The whole experience is so different than the average nice hotel. What a room! HUGE ROOM, refrigerator, microwave, stove, several televisions, huge bathroom, several closets, great decor and super nice people. I think the value for what you get here is exceptional. Very upscale! Not to mention the breakfast that comes with the room and good food in the evening, including wine and beer (I don't drink), soft drinks, water etc. and all complementary.  It's in a great area and very close to many things. For those who like shopping stores… South Coast Plaza is just a few minutes away.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know how much you enjoyed your stay at the Residence Inn Costa Mesa Newport Beach.  We are so glad you got to enjoy our spacious suite, the full breakfast in the morning, and the Residence Inn Mix.  Our location is so close to South Coast Plaza and the beaches and glad that you got to explore Orange County.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We have stayed here several times dealing with family medical issues. We are so thankful for the comfort, care, and personal touches we receive here. Sue Cooke greets us like family members now. With rooms with a kitchen, free breakfasts, wine and beer in the evenings, laundry facilities, exercise room, and a sports court, what's not to like? Sue has garnered and maintained a great team. It is nice to see the same smiling, helpful people on multiple trips. And, the rooms are getting a major update in the next couple of months!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us at the Residence Inn Costa Mesa.  We are so happy you enjoyed our central location near South Coast Plaza, Beaches, and John Wayne Airport.  We hope you will come see our new renovated rooms next year and we are planning to expand our fitness room next year also.  Thanks again for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us!

Summary Heading: Nice choice in a central location
Summary: Finding the Costa Mesa Residence Inn is easy with a GPS, but may be confusing for those who don't know the freeways in the area.  It is one of the older Residence Inns, but is kept in good condition and the management is very congenial.  Airport and traffic noise were not a problem.  Access to shopping, beach and airport is easy from the hotel.  They are doing renovations in 2016.  Drawbacks for those who care:  very small pool area and health club.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sounds like you took time to explore our great area with South Coast Plaza, beaches, and some great dining selections.  We are excited to start our renovation in just a few weeks to update our rooms.  We hope you will come and see the new suites on your next visit to the area.

Summary Heading: should have been better than it was..
Summary: Nice enough hotel. Very popular and full. Our room hadn't had the trash emptied and there were tiny flies landing on our drinks and all around us. I asked reception if they had a spray and whilst we vacated our room they sprayed for us. It made a big difference but didn't completely get rid of them. The WiFi was very patchy and mostly didn't work. Had a shower and washed my hair in the morning only to find there wasn't a dryer in our room. In my opinion three things wrong isn't good enough. Breakfast was fine but very very busy.
Manager Response: Thank for taking the time to offer feedback on our hotel and staff.   It is very important for us to inform our guests of the value we place on all comments and concerns both negative as well as positive. It is only by such information that we may continue to offer the standards of quality that Marriott aims to provide. Our goal is to make sure that your stay is pleasant and we are unhappy to hear we were not successful in accomplishing that, you are right three things wrong isn’t good enough.  We are actually upgrading our internet this week so we will be able to provide a faster, reliable wi-fi connection to our guests.  We will also be talking to our staff about making sure the rooms are not missing any items and that the trash isn’t overlooked.  Once again, thank you for staying with us, we appreciate your comments and hope you will visit us again and we can provide a better experience.

Summary: I call yesterday to see if I can check in early at 1:00 on Saturday, 9/26. They told me no problem. On Saturday I arrived around 1:30 to check in. The front desk Deven told me he room was really. They were booked yesterday. He told me he room will be really 1 hour to 1 1/2 hours. I came back after 2:30 to see if it really and of course not. He give me some excuse that it's needed deep cleaning so it take long. It's 3:30 I'm still sitting here. However the whole time I'm sitting he doesn't even bother to check in with to see if I needed anything.
Manager Response: Our apologies about the delay at check in.  The check in time is 4pm, so I’m sorry we were unable to accommodate an early check in.  The rooms usually take around 45mins to an hour to clean, but sometimes a deeper clean is needed as we want to ensure the room you get is spotless.  We should have offered you some type of beverage for the inconvenience of the wait.  We hope you enjoyed the room, once able to check in.  Thank you for your feedback, we will talk to our staff about ensuring a more accurate wait time for the room.

Summary: This hotel is in a great area. You can walk to a lot of restaurants and shops. Near the freeways and not too far from the beach. It's one of those hotels with doors that open to the outside, which some people don't like.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying at the Marriott Residence Inn Costa Mesa.  We are delighted you explored the surrounding area. Hopefully you got to enjoy some of the extensive dining and shopping nearby or got to relax at the beach.  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Acceptable property for an extended stay
Summary: I stayed with the Residence Inn for a fortnight during a business trip and found the hotel to be very average. The room that I stayed in had very poor noise insulation.   First off, the room wasn't ready even though it was prebooked and just came off an 21 hr flight and 3 hr delay due to an accident in the freeway.  Found it completely unacceptable.    It happened to be 3rd July weekend and the guests above my room were partying loudly and had a very poor sleep despite the jet lag!    The room is situated close to the school district bus yard and every day the noise of buses leaving the yard was very disturbing early in the day.   As an International traveller, I had lot of enquiries for the staff and they were pretty much clueless about everything I asked them and made no
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback.  We apologize for the delay in check in, 4th of July is one of our busiest travel times and I’m sorry we couldn’t accommodate your early arrival.  We are so glad you enjoyed our location being so close to the beach, South Coast Plaza and an array of restaurants, as well as able to utilize our complimentary shuttle.  If your are planning another stay, please feel free to give us a call and request an area away from the school, we would be happy to accommodate your request.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.

Summary: Nicely equipped kitchen with full sized fridge and stove. Couch in front of the TV, clean and spacious. Very clean. If you have to stay in the area this is a good alternative to a hotel as it is more like a small apartment. More expensive than most hotels but if you prefer to cook your own food and like some extra room it evens out. Decent free breakfast, they vary the potatoes and eggs each day. Make your own waffles etc. Not great but way better than most. Wifi is slow but they offer to upgrade for a fee if you need faster. I used my phones hot spot so I didn't care. Good location close to freeways and shopping but far enough away from these things to be tranquil.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay here at the Residence Inn Costa Mesa.  We are always working to vary the menu at breakfast and are happy to hear you enjoyed our selections.  I do apologize for the internet speed, the hotel will be upgrading the internet service in November.  Residence Inn does specialize in long term stay, so we pride ourselves in offering a spacious room with all the amenities to cook and provide you a “home away from home”. We are looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Being that we travel quite frequently for sporting events this hotel was recommended as a team hotel for our traveling team.  Rooms are small and appear to not have been thoroughly cleaned. Surprise find was a huge brown spot on the sheet of the pull out couch. With other choices nearby would be wiser to go elsewhere.
Manager Response: I appreciate you letting us know about your stay with us.  I am sorry to hear that the room was not cleaned properly and would appreciate you sending me an email to let me know what room you stayed in so we can address these issues.  I hope that you will let me know if you will be returning to the area so I can ensure that you have a great room.

Summary: We stayed here to catch the ferry from Newport Beach in the morning.  It's super close to a HUGE mall, so great for location for any shoppers.  However, we were underwhelmed with the actual place.  The lobby was nice enough, and the breakfast buffet was good.  We have stayed at many other Residence Inns, and the rooms just did not seem up to par.  Don't know if this was converted from a previous hotel, but that's the feeling it had.  Rooms were kind of old, including bathroom, and felt like it needed to be updated.  AC was noisy.  There was a lot of noise from the highway too.  Would try a different hotel next time I need to stay in the same area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay with us. Our location is great with it being so close to both South Coast Plaza and the beaches.  I apologize that our rooms were not up to the standard you have come to expect with Marriott.  We are planning a rooms renovation in November to update our rooms. I would appreciate if you could email me and let me know more details about your stay so I can follow up with our team to make improvements for the future.

Summary: The hotel is well located, the breakfast is great, and the pet-friendly policy is welcoming with lots of green grass around pet areas.  The only negatives were: one unfriendly office manager (the rest if the staff was great) and a very noisy guest staying above our room.  Although this wasn't the hotel's fault, it was annoying.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  I am so happy that you like the location - it is so close to the beaches and South Coast Plaza.  I am sorry to hear that our staff was not friendly and did not go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  I appreciate the information and will review with our staff.  We hope you will come back again and enjoy Costa Mesa again.

Summary: From the minute we arrived , we received above average service. The property had great looking landscaping. Super clean in and out. Very roomy. felt like I was in a Condo complex rather than a Hotel complex.
Manager Response: I am so happy you enjoyed staying at our Residence Inn Costa Mesa.  The rooms are so spacious and having a fully equipped kitchen is a nice benefit when traveling.  Our staff loves to hear how much you enjoyed your stay and will be sure to share this with them.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was amazing for the price we paid. The staff was very helpful and kind and helped us with absolutely everything we needed. They were able to accommodate our rather large family (we have six children) with a two bedroom suite. Tuesday's free dinner was amazing and their breakfast buffet is pretty good. They also have a free shuttle that takes you anywhere in a five mile radius and the staff was very helpful about finding out places it would take us. Overall the staff and friendly environment here was amazing and they will most definitely be receiving my business again.
Manager Response: We are so happy you brought your family to the Residence Inn Costa Mesa.  We love to have families come and start your day with a great breakfast and finish the day with a nice meal.  The Penthouse Suite is great for families and having two bedrooms and 2 bathrooms really helps out.  We hope this will not be the last time we see your family and look forward to welcoming you "home".

Summary: Good for travelers who like to cook. Buffet breakfast that's decent. Liked the multiple Waffle makers. Not far from OC Airport, stores, restaurants and South Coast Plaza. Apartment style layout. Furniture outdated. Overall, not bad for the price
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your time at the Costa Mesa Residence Inn.  Our location is great for easy access to beaches, shopping, and John Wayne Airport.  We are looking to begin  a rooms renovation in November to help update our rooms and hope you will come see the new suites.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I was on vacation with my family of 6 and we stayed in Residence Inn Costa Mesa. The location is in close proximity to South Coast Plaza which is like a 5 min drive and Mitsuwa Marketplace which is is Japanese supermarket. Apart from the excellent location, the suite room was very clean. The free breakfast was also a convenience for us as we could go on our sightseeing/shopping immediately after eating. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. I would strongly recommend this hotel for families.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for making the Residence Inn Costa Mesa your "home away from home" while traveling.  We are so happy the family enjoyed our location which is close to South Coast Plaza and many great stores like Mitsuwa.  And breakfast starts your day off and so glad you enjoyed all the variety we offer.  I hope that you will come visit us again soon. Sue Cooke

Summary: Loved the grounds and staff.  Place is overall clean.  Great location for us with free parking and some great restaurants  in walking distance.   King studio is small with desk area crammed into kitchen.  Door was really tough to open and close, even for my husband.  Sorry but the hotel just looks tired.  Marriott needs to put some money into this one.  They have upgraded cabinets and countertops, but the carpets, lino, sofa and drapes should be retired.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback on the hotel.  I will be sure to let the staff know about your comments and so glad you were able to enjoy all that Costa Mesa has to offer with our location near South Coast Plaza and the beaches. We are sorry that the rooms are not as up to date as you have come to expect with Marriott but we are planning a rooms renovation in November to address your concerns.  I hope you will come back and see the changes!  Thank you again for taking the time to let us know about your stay.

Summary: I was attending a conference at the Hilton in Costa Mesa & had a 5 day voucher with Marriott along with airline miles so used the voucher here.  We had asked prior to arriving and again once arriving to upgrade to a 2 bedroom, as I was travelling with a girlfriend, but they were unable to help us with this request, stating it was "spring break".  We asked after the first night to be moved from the first floor as our neighbor upstairs woke us up early in the morning.  They were very courteous at moving us to a 2nd floor room the next day.  The hotel was within 1 mile of the HIlton, so I chose to walk to the conference every morning after enjoying the complimentary breakfast each morning.  The area is vey close to The Camp. so walked to the Wine Lab & other places in The Camp,
Manager Response: We are so excited that you enjoyed staying at the Costa Mesa Residence Inn.   I am so glad that the location worked out so great for you while traveling for business.  The Camp and Lab are so unique and offer some great dining options.  And we have added gluten free breads during breakfast as we have many guests that have dietary needs.  Please come back and visit us again when you are visiting Orange County.

Summary Heading: Residence Inns are the way to go for any Marriott!
Summary: Staff in the lobby are so helpful and accommodating. Carmellia was a pleasure to work with and always made us feel welcomed. Breakfast buffet is worth waking up out of your comfy bed for. Also, the location just minutes from the freeway makes OC accessible for you in any direction. South Coast Plaza is just down the street!
